title: Participatory Budgeting – Simple Tier
author: CivHub
summary: A civic process in which residents vote on how to allocate a portion of a public budget across community-proposed projects.

steps.label: Proposal Collection
steps.description: Residents or organizations submit project proposals for public funding.

steps.label: Eligibility Review
steps.description: Review board screens proposals for budget fit and feasibility.

steps.label: Public Voting
steps.description: Eligible residents vote on approved proposals, typically using ranked-choice or cumulative voting.

steps.label: Allocation & Reporting
steps.description: Winning proposals receive funding and implementation schedules are published.
